Conquest of Kannauj

Indra III achieved great military successes during his brief reign. He defeated the Pratihara king Mahipala I, thoroughly plundering and devastating Kannauj. This was one of the most decisive victories of the Rashtrakutas in North India.

ЁЯМН
Account of Al-Masudi

The renowned Baghdadi traveler Al-Masudi visited India during his reign in 915 AD. He called Indra III the 'Greatest King of India' among the 'Ballhara' (Vallabha-raja) kings and described the vastness and power of the Rashtrakuta Empire.

тЪЦя╕П
Administration

According to Al-Masudi, the Rashtrakuta administration was very organized, and their relations with Arab traders were very good.
